definitions.definition: A unit of weight for precious stones and pearls, equivalent to 200 milligrams.

definitions.definition: To perplex (someone).

To slice, bone or make into fillets.
To apply, create, or specify a rounded or filled corner to.

The Abrahamic doctrine that each individual human soul is created by God, as opposed to traducianism.

Any creationary belief, especially a belief that the origin of things is due to an event or process of creation brought about by the deliberate act of any divine agency, such as a Creator God (creator god).

A circle of light; a halo.

One of the square logs of wood used in a pile to support the roof of a mine.

Short for noggin.

A dark-skinned person; nig-nog.

A severe mental disorder, sometimes with physical damage to the brain, marked by a deranged personality and a distorted view of reality.
Exhibiting social ability or cleverness.

definitions.definition: Efficient; vigorous; brilliant.

(NGO jargon, of land) Under cultivation (within any quinquennial period) for the production of crops sown and harvested within the same agricultural year (contrasted with permanently-cropped lands such as orchards).
The back side of anything, the part opposite its front, particularly:
The reverse or opposite of anything.
The state or condition of being parallel; agreement in direction, tendency, or character.
The state of being in agreement or similarity; resemblance, correspondence, analogy.
A parallel position; the relation of parallels.
(grammar) The juxtaposition of two or more identical or equivalent syntactic constructions, especially those expressing the same sentiment with slight modifications, introduced for rhetorical effect.
The doctrine that matter and mind do not causally interact but that physiological events in the brain or body nonetheless occur simultaneously with matching events in the mind.
In antitrust law, the practice of competitors of raising prices by roughly the same amount at roughly the same time, without engaging in a formal agreement to do so.
Similarity of features between two species resulting from their having taken similar evolutionary paths following their initial divergence from a common ancestor.
The use of parallel methods in hardware or software, so that several tasks can be performed at the same time.
(of champagne) very dry, and not sweet
The language of a people or a national language.
definitions.example: A vernacular of the United States is English.

definitions.definition: Everyday speech or dialect, including colloquialisms, as opposed to standard, literary, liturgical, or scientific idiom.
definitions.example: Street vernacular can be quite different from what is heard elsewhere.

definitions.definition: Language unique to a particular group of people; jargon, argot.
definitions.example: For those of a certain age, hiphop vernacular might just as well be a foreign language.

definitions.definition: A language lacking standardization or a written form.
Indigenous spoken language, as distinct from a literary or liturgical language such as Ecclesiastical Latin.
definitions.example: Vatican II allowed the celebration of the mass in the vernacular.

definitions.definition: Of or pertaining to everyday language, as opposed to standard, literary, liturgical, or scientific idiom.
Belonging to the country of one's birth; one's own by birth or nature; native; indigenous.
definitions.example: a vernacular disease

definitions.definition: Of or related to local building materials and styles; not imported.
Connected to a collective memory; not imported.
The angular distance north or south from a planet's equator, measured along the meridian of that particular point.
An imaginary line (in fact a circumference) around a planet running parallel to the planet's equator.
The relative freedom from restrictions; scope to do something.
definitions.example: His parents gave him a great deal of latitude.

definitions.definition: The angular distance of a heavenly body from the ecliptic.
The extent to which a light-sensitive material can be over- or underexposed and still achieve an acceptable result.
Extent or scope; e.g. breadth, width or amplitude.

One of a class of caustic bases, such as soda, soda ash, caustic soda, potash, ammonia, and lithia, whose distinguishing peculiarities are solubility in alcohol and water, uniting with oils and fats to form soap, neutralizing and forming salts with acids, turning to brown several vegetable yellows, and changing reddened litmus to blue.
(Western United States) Soluble mineral matter, other than common salt, contained in soils of natural waters.
To cut down grass or crops.
definitions.example: He mowed the lawn every few weeks in the summer.

definitions.definition: To cut down or slaughter in great numbers.
To make grimaces, mock.
To put into mows.
The activity by which something is mown.
Land from which grass is cut.
A drug that numbs the pain in the body.
Containing nuts.
definitions.example: This is a nutty chocolate bar.

definitions.definition: Resembling or characteristic of nuts.
Barmy, crazy, mad.
definitions.example: Your wife is as nutty as a fruitcake.

definitions.definition: Extravagantly fashionable
To be able to see beforehand: to anticipate; predict.
To provide.
A room containing a public toilet: a public lavatory.
definitions.example: Could you tell me where I can find the restroom?

definitions.definition: To cut free.
definitions.example: After he graduated, he severed all links to his family.

definitions.definition: To suffer disjunction; to be parted or separated.
To make a separation or distinction; to distinguish.
To disunite; to disconnect; to terminate.
definitions.example: to sever an estate in joint tenancy

definitions.definition: A malignant tumour arising from cells of the bone marrow, specifically plasma cells.
To consume, exhaust (some resource)
(of money) to spend, disburse
The most essential part; the main idea or substance (of a longer or more complicated matter); the crux of a matter; the pith.
The essential ground for action in a suit, without which there is no cause of action.
Resting place (especially of animals), lodging.
To summarize, to extract and present the most important parts of.
The sister or sister-in-law of one’s parent.
The female cousin of one’s parent.
A woman of an older generation than oneself, especially a friend of one's parents, by means of fictive kin.
Any elderly woman.
A procuress or bawd.
Term of familiarity or respect for a middle-aged or elderly woman.
To be or behave like the aunt of.
A blanket or throw, usually crocheted or knitted.
A type of iced chocolate biscuit, sometimes containing cornflakes and topped with a walnut.
Any of various marine bivalve molluscs of the family Pectinidae which are free-swimming.
One of a series of curves, forming an edge similar to a scallop shell.
A fillet of meat, escalope.
A form of fried potato.
A dish shaped like a scallop shell.
To censure (someone or something); to criticize.
To bring into disrepute.

(usually followed by "for") To assert or consider that someone is the cause of something negative; to place blame, to attribute responsibility (for something negative or for doing something negative).
definitions.example: The arsonist was blamed for the fire.

definitions.definition: To divide into smaller sections.
To divide divisions into smaller divisions.
Having divisions that are themselves divided into smaller divisions
Divided into many small divisions
In a vivid manner.
Having a feeling arising from a consciousness of well-being or of enjoyment; enjoying good of any kind, such as comfort, peace, or tranquillity; blissful, contented, joyous.
definitions.example: Music makes me feel happy.

definitions.definition: Experiencing the effect of favourable fortune; favored by fortune or luck; fortunate, lucky, propitious.
Content, satisfied (with or to do something); having no objection (to something).
definitions.example: Are you happy to pay me back by the end of the week?

definitions.definition: (Of acts, speech, etc.) Appropriate, apt, felicitous.
definitions.example: a happy coincidence

definitions.definition: (in combination) Favoring or inclined to use.
definitions.example: slaphappy, trigger-happy

definitions.definition: (of people, often followed by "at" or "in") Dexterous, ready, skilful.
Any action taken to counteract or correct another.
definitions.example: We fear that this will be the beginning of a negative development of measures and countermeasures, at the end of which there will be no winner CNN-money, Why President Trump's obsession with German cars is misplaced, Jackie Wattles and Charles Riley, May 31, 2018

definitions.definition: (chiefly in the plural) Any of the devices and techniques used to impair the operational effectiveness of an enemy.
A wild (uncultivated) flowering plant.
A flower from such a plant.
Minimalist; lacking that which is not essential.
definitions.example: Meals on early space flights were bare-bones affairs; able to supply nutrition, but severely lacking in palatability.

definitions.definition: Describes a computer sold pre-assembled, but without certain essential components, often a processor, memory, and hard drive.
A very lean person, especially one whose bones show through the skin
A sheep of a Spanish breed with long, fine hair.
The wool of this sheep.
The fabric made from this wool (or from any similar yarn).
A yarn made from a combination of wool and cotton in imitation of this wool.
To keep back; to retain.
definitions.example: We reserve the right to make modifications.

definitions.definition: To keep in store for future or special use.
definitions.example: This cake is reserved for the guests!

definitions.definition: To book in advance; to make a reservation.
definitions.example: I reserved a table for us at the best restaurant in town.

definitions.definition: To make an exception of; to except.
One who knowingly allows himself or herself to be used for another's profit; a dupe.
A straight man.
A secret informant for police.
A confederate; a person who is secretly working for the researcher, unknown to the study participant.
A dessert made by boiling flavoured gelatin in water
To notch; to jag; to cut into points like a row of teeth
definitions.example: to indent the edge of paper

definitions.definition: To be cut, notched, or dented.
To dent; to stamp or to press in; to impress
definitions.example: indent a smooth surface with a hammer

definitions.definition: To cut the two halves of a document in duplicate, using a jagged or wavy line so that each party could demonstrate that their copy was part of the original whole.
To enter into a binding agreement by means of such documents; to formally commit (to doing something); to contract.
To engage (someone), originally by means of indented contracts.
definitions.example: to indent a young man to a shoemaker; to indent a servant

definitions.definition: To begin (a line or lines) at a greater or lesser distance from the margin. See indentation, and indention. Normal indent pushes in a line or paragraph. "hanging indent" pulls the line out into the margin.
definitions.example: to indent the first line of a paragraph one em

definitions.definition: To crook or turn; to wind in and out; to zigzag.
To make an order upon; to draw upon, as for military stores.
Cut in the edge into points or inequalities, like teeth; jagged; notched; stamped in; dented on the surface.
Having an uneven, irregular border; sinuous; undulating.
definitions.example: a heavily indented coastline

definitions.definition: Notched like the part of a saw consisting of the teeth; serrated.
definitions.example: an indented border or ordinary

definitions.definition: Bound out by an indenture; apprenticed; indentured.
definitions.example: an indented servant

definitions.definition: Notched along the margin with a different color, like the feathers of some birds.
The chemical element (symbol Ba) with an atomic number of 56. It is a soft, reactive, silvery alkaline earth metal.
A single atom of this element.
Barium sulfate suspension.
Pertaining to or shaped like a torus, or a section of a torus; toroidal.
To steal, especially as part of war, riot or other group violence.
definitions.example: 1833 "Gunganarian, the leader of the Chooars, continues his system of looting and murder", The asiatic Journal and monthly register for British India and its Dependencies Black, Parbury & Allen, p. 66.

definitions.definition: To steal from.
definitions.example: to loot a temple for valuables

definitions.definition: To examine the corpse of a fallen enemy for loot.
The act of stealing during a general disturbance.
definitions.example: During the looting, the mob stole everything they could and then set fire to the buildings.

definitions.definition: To make a sound from the vocal chords without pronouncing any real words, with one's lips closed.
definitions.example: We are humming happily along with the music.

definitions.definition: To express by humming.
definitions.example: The team ominously hummed “We shall overcome” as they came back onto the field after the break.

definitions.definition: To drone like certain insects naturally do in motion, or sounding similarly
To buzz, be busily active like a beehive
definitions.example: The streets were humming with activity.

definitions.definition: To produce low sounds which blend continuously
To reek, smell bad.
definitions.example: This room really hums — have you ever tried spring cleaning, mate?

definitions.definition: To flatter by approving; to cajole; to deceive or impose upon; to humbug.
The sound of something that hums; a hum.
To renounce all claim to; to deny ownership of or responsibility for; to disown; to disavow; to reject.
To deny, as a claim; to refuse.
To relinquish or deny having a claim; to disavow another's claim; to decline accepting, as an estate, interest, or office.
Of, or having, hydrophobia (rabies).
Lacking an affinity for water; unable to absorb, or be wetted by water.
